intro: Navarretia filifolia subsp. sparsiflora, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It is a short-lived perennial that produces seeds in late spring, and it is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of native flora.
